title: 2021 In Review
description: Here we are at the end of 2021 and I‚Äôm feeling damned good about what‚Äôs going on in my life. I feel like I‚Äôm more focused than ever and I‚Äôm super energized to get better as a father, friend, and professional (in that order).

children.value: Here we are at the end of 2021 and I‚Äôm feeling damned good about what‚Äôs going on in my life. I feel like I‚Äôm more focused than ever and I‚Äôm super energized to get better as a father, friend, and professional (in that order).
I didn‚Äôt take very many Ls in 2021 so I‚Äôm sure 2022 will have something to say about that because you know, balance.
ü•à This is my second biggest W of 2021 (having a baby narrowly edges it out for the number one spot).
This new job was a big move for my career. It‚Äôs a pretty massive leap in responsibility and is more aligned with my skills and career goals, which is fantastic.
With this new job came a newfound sense of self-identity. I‚Äôve always thought of myself as a User Interface Developer. A fancy way of saying a designer who can code.
My new role is more specifically in the User Experience side of things and I‚Äôm loving it. Now I pay
more attention to stuff like user flows, accessibility, usability, wire-framing, user interviews, and user behavior.
I focus much more on the
Now I view myself as a User-Focused Web Developer.
ü•á My biggest W of 2021 is that I had my second (and last) kid this year! Great feeling to finally have this little dude around.
Also, I got a dog. I‚Äôm not sure how I feel about this but it‚Äôs ok on most days.

Student loans can kick rocks. I‚Äôm convinced they‚Äôre one of the biggest scams ever and they need to get with the times. There‚Äôs absolutely no need to go tens of thousands of dollars into debt to get into tech (or probably most other careers).

Although I‚Äôve probably put more miles on my feet in 2021 than I ever have before, I‚Äôm eating like garbage. It‚Äôs not that I‚Äôm eating bad foods, I‚Äôm just eating way too much. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because I‚Äôve been inside more or what, but I eat out of pure boredom.
I‚Äôm super grateful for my somewhat fast metabolism but that won‚Äôt last forever.
Too much whiskey and not enough kale.

Mostly because of my new role, I‚Äôve been studying the nuts and bolts of user behavior and trying to align products to best fit their needs. A lot of this is just taking a step back before the design phase and asking questions that try to figure out what the user is trying to do.
Now that I‚Äôm in this ‚Äònew‚Äô world, I realized that in the past, I used to design stuff and make it look pretty without providing a real solution to the user.
I really think with me studying the UX side of things, it‚Äôs going to supercharge my skills as a professional in this field.

Nothing super new here. Refined my CSS and JavaScript skills further. It‚Äôs kind of strange to say because I would have never thought I‚Äôd say this a few years ago but, I feel comfortable with JavaScript.
If nothing else, 2021 was filled with a lot of ‚Äúah-ha‚Äù moments.

Actually something new, I finally started learning React this past year. I put it off for a while because I got sick of hearing about it on Twitter. React this, React that. I‚Äôve always been a bit rebellious when it came to new trends and this was no different.

I picked up a guitar about three years ago and for the first year and a half, it just sat on the stand. Collecting a lot of dust. It's a strange thing to purchase something because you want to learn it, but when it comes time to actually learn it, the desire goes away.
... well, that‚Äôs not totally true. I did try to learn and it was so difficult that I quit. Which was embarrassing because I‚Äôve
I chalk it up as being undisciplined (something I try not to be).

I decided to pick up back up in the past year or so I've started putting in the time and I'm loving the progress I've made. The guitar is unbelievably difficult but that's why I do it every day. It feels good to see some wins.
I forgot how much I liked to read.
I borrowed a Kindle from a co-worker and my god do I love reading on
. Shoutout to her for letting me borrow it because I don‚Äôt think I would have bought one without having done so.
For the longest period of time, I was back and forth on getting a Kindle because I thought I‚Äôd "miss the feeling of holding a real book."
: I don‚Äôt miss it. The Kindle is amazing, the battery lasts forever,
and I find myself doing a lot more reading than I used to.
I‚Äôve never been the kind of person to make highlights in books. So instead, I‚Äôve started keeping notes and summaries on what I call my
. This is a place for me to capture thoughts about
of the books that‚Äôs I‚Äôve read that I can go back and reference.

Life is good. I‚Äôm in a good place in just about all aspects of my life. Maybe it‚Äôs because I‚Äôm 32 but I feel a heightened sense of purpose and drive. I‚Äôm no longer trying to find out who I am and what I want to do.
Now I need to spend time sharpening those.
These are somewhat vague and aren‚Äôt directly tied to my
thinking about what‚Äôs next. How can I get better? Can I restructure my days to get more done? Why did I say that? Is this good enough? Am I a fraud?
Slow down and enjoy life. It‚Äôs not only the scenery you miss by going too fast ‚Äì you also miss the sense of where you are going and why.
In 2022, I need to slow down and enjoy the moment. Especially with my little ones.
I know how to make websites
good. In 2022, I‚Äôm going to focus more on the ‚Äúhow can I make this amazing for the user" side of things.
My aim is to read at
20 books in 2022. I think that‚Äôs very doable especially considering I have a Kindle now.

Like most other creative people, I‚Äôm my own worst critic and enemy. Ironically, I feel the best when I create stuff. Whether that‚Äôs drawing, designing, coding, or writing. It feels good to have made something that didn‚Äôt exist before I created it.
I hate that I feel like I‚Äôm in this vortex of never-ending information consumption. One side of me feels like I
to because I need to stay up-to-date in the industry and tech. The other side of me feels like I know the fundamentals and that will never change.
2022 is going to be a year of ignoring the fear of missing out (FOMO) and embracing the joy of missing out (JOMO).
I had a great year all around. The current state of the world gives me a little concern because I have to raise two kids in it but I‚Äôm optimistic.

summary: 2021 was great for me mentally, financially, and spiritually. Not so much physically.

title: Impossible List
description: Ever since I came across Thomas Frank‚Äôs impossible list I knew I had to make one for myself. He got the idea from a dude named Joel Runyon who I believe is the founder of impossible lists.

children.value: I knew I had to make one for myself. He got the idea from a dude named
who I believe is the founder of impossible lists.

I‚Äôll be 100% honest here, I took a lot of Thomas Frank‚Äôs goal categories because they were great categories quite frankly (no pun intended). Almost every productive person has goals that they want to achieve, but putting them somewhere public will not only hold you accountable but also keep you reminded of what you‚Äôre aiming for.
I'm working on improving my User Interface and User Experience design skills while simultaneously trying to learn Vue 3 and vanilla JavaScript more deeply (doing both is difficult).
I'm also in a constant battle with imposter syndrome and it's a back and forth battle. At the moment, I'm winning and feeling pretty confident but it comes and goes.
Lastly and always, I'm working on becoming a better person and appreciating the moment as much as I can.
Learn a full song on the guitar (January, 2022)
Learn five full songs on the guitar (May-ish, 2022)
Learn five full songs on the guitar (September-ish, 2022)
Learn a full song on the guitar
Learn five full songs on the guitar
Learn ten full songs on the guitar
Perform a song on the guitar at a campfire
Perform a song on the guitar at a bar/restaurant
Fast for 400 hours in a month
Intermittent fast for at least 13 hours per day, for a full month
Pay off student loans by December 2022
Write a fiction book (at least 50,000 words)
Self-publish a book on Amazon (less than 15,000)
Publish a paperback or hardcover book
Help a turtle cross the street
Volunteer at Feed the Starving Children

Similar to who I got the idea from, I would encourage you to create your own impossible list. It‚Äôs kind of difficult to come up with goals off of the top of your head, at least it was for me, so I would recommend checking out Thomas‚Äô or taking goals from this one. I think it‚Äôs ideal to have it somewhere digital but there‚Äôs nothing wrong with paper and pencil too. Just make sure you account for adding sub-goals and even sub-categories.

summary: An impossible list is a catalog of challenges that you have given yourself. Unlike a bucket list which is static and gets smaller as you complete the items, an impossible list will grow and evolve with you as you live.

title: Vibe Check #1
description: January was great. It‚Äôs likely due to the normal ‚ÄúNew year, new me‚Äù that everyone gets but I really do feel like a new me. I didn‚Äôt make the mistake of setting resolutions for the year because every time I do, I either:

children.value: January was great. It‚Äôs likely due to the normal ‚ÄúNew year, new me‚Äù that everyone gets but I really do feel like a new me. I didn‚Äôt make the mistake of setting resolutions for the year because every time I do, I either:
Don‚Äôt do the goal I set

One of the biggest things I‚Äôve learned about goals is that you have to avoid the temptation of making the goal too grand in the beginning. It makes sense too. The goal you‚Äôre trying to set likely is a new behavior or metric you want to hit. To expect yourself to hit that goal right away is unrealistic. Also, I‚Äôm not sure about you but I like seeing progress. Whenever I set a goal that‚Äôs too big and I don‚Äôt see progress, it‚Äôs very demoralizing.
Random note, I decided I‚Äôm retiring from fantasy football. I don‚Äôt need that stress in my life anymore.
I managed to go the entire month of January without drinking a single drop of alcohol. That was an item on my
so it feels pretty good to check one-off. It was surprisingly easy, but I do enjoy a nightcap after a large meal. I must say, I feel like my head is

Another win, if you ask me is how much I‚Äôve been reading. Like I‚Äôve mentioned a million times (at least it feels like a million times to me) is that I bought a Kindle recently and I‚Äôve been reading like a madman. Loving it. I‚Äôve been finding a ton of new books on
I‚Äôve never been much of a ‚Äòhighlight in my books‚Äô kind of guy so I‚Äôm doing my best to do a short
write-up of the books I‚Äôve finished
here. This has been helping me remember what I read and pay more attention to what I‚Äôm reading.
My biggest win this month was my diet for sure. I just ate less overall.
Not too many losses to report here. I‚Äôm working on building an office in my basement and I planned on working on it. Turns out, I literally did nothing down there.
Just the one post but I‚Äôm proud of it and that‚Äôs all that matters.
Jakob‚Äôs Law and How To Use It
: A quick overview of a crucial law of UX to understand how to apply it to your work.
Since getting a kindle, I‚Äôve been doing much more reading than usual.
Fasted every day for at least 16 hours
Work on office in the basement

summary: I feel like I owned this month. My life is in a great spot and I'm feeling better than ever.

title: Vibe Check #2
description: In previous years, the shortest month of the year seems to always be the most unproductive for me. This past one was no different but this time around, I‚Äôm not bummed about it.

children.value: In previous years, the shortest month of the year seems to always be the most unproductive for me. This past one was no different but this time around, I‚Äôm not bummed about it.

This reading train is still ongoing and doesn‚Äôt seem to be slowing down. I‚Äôm absolutely loving my time spent reading and look forward to eventually getting to the massive amount of books I have saved for later.
I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs a placebo or not but since I‚Äôve been reading basically every day, I
like I‚Äôm remembering better. I guess whether it‚Äôs a placebo or not, the fact that I‚Äôm
it is good enough for me.
I lost quite a few pounds in February and I‚Äôm getting close to my goal weight of 185.
I didn‚Äôt do any writing this past month. However, I did attend a few writing-focused meetups. I took a massive L in the writing department.
Saying that I still have lofty writing goals.

The World is in a constant state of sadness. Especially if you watch the news or go out looking for bad stuff. One might say, ‚ÄúWell just don‚Äôt watch the news.‚Äù Not a bad point but that doesn‚Äôt change the fact that bad things still happen around the world.

Since becoming a father five years ago, my number one priority has been to set my kids up for success. I worry that World will not give my kids a fair shot at it. It appears that the more time that passes, the worse things seem to get and my kids will have to navigate this strange environment.
to my reading time. So many good books, such little time.
Made some progress on the basement
Learned a new song on the guitar called Clay Pigeons
Work on the office in the basement

summary: Felt like a down month in terms of hitting goals but still feeling great.

title: Vibe Check #3
description: Got through an incredibly uneventful month where the only thing I have to show is an injured foot that seemingly came out of nowhere. The dog is slowly ruining our yard but the baby is doing barrel rolls across the floor so that‚Äôs cool to watch.

children.value: Got through an incredibly uneventful month where the only thing I have to show is an injured foot that seemingly came out of nowhere. The dog is slowly ruining our yard but the baby is doing barrel rolls across the floor so that‚Äôs cool to watch.

Not really any wins to report here. March in Minnesota is basically the equivalent of being an NPC in SimCity where the overloads throw in random weather events. I‚Äôll call that a win because I like a little randomness.
I did something to my foot this past month so it put a
damper on my running. I literally did nothing in March that required me to put a lot of weight and pressure on my feet. This is easily the slowest healing injury I‚Äôve ever had.
Ziltch, but made great progress on two longer posts. Excited to share those next month.
: A memoir from Will Smith. I‚Äôm a gigantic fan of this man and hilariously, I finished his book the same day he smacked Chris Rock.
embarrassing moment for Will but his memoir was a great read. It was a bit heavy-handed with the braggy parts of basically every chapter, but
you can get over that, there‚Äôs a lot to take away from it.
might be my new favorite author. While I didn‚Äôt love
and I loved Ring Shout too. It‚Äôs essentially a fantasy/horror take on the KKK and hate-breeding hate. A short read, filled with action and a creative take on monsters.
I started reading ‚ÄúThe Mis-Education of the Negro‚Äù but stopped reading it because I found it
Made good progress on my basement, I think I‚Äôll be ready to move down there at the end of April

summary: Uneventful month but I made some great progress on some house projects.
